body.body: The numbers in brackets in the following text refer to the exploded view

When using a press, always wear overalls, eye, face and hand protection. Objects such as bearings frequently break up under load and the debris caused during break-up may cause damage and injury to unprotected parts of the body.
Never wear loose clothing which could become trapped in the press and cause crushing injury to the hand, arms or other parts of the anatomy.
Working from the opposite end to where the clutch assembly is fitted, dismantle the input shaft as follows:
Remove the pegged bearing sleeve (1) from the end of the shaft.

Place the input shaft in a press with second gear (3) uppermost. Use a suitable tool to support the second gear. Protect the shaft with a thread protector or similar and press the input shaft through the second gear.
Remove sixth gear (4), complete with the splined bush (5) which runs inside the gear.
Remove the thrust washer (6) from in front of the circlip between sixth and third/fourth gear (8).
Remove the circlip (7) from the shaft.
Slide off the combined third/fourth gear (8).
Remove the circlip (9) from in front of fifth gear (11).
Remove the thrust washer (10) adjacent to fifth gear (11).
Remove fifth gear (11) and fifth gear bush (16) from the input shaft.

Place the shaft in a press with the input shaft bearing (13) supported on press bars and the clutch end of the shaft facing the press ram. Protect the shaft thread with a thread protector or similar and press the shaft through the bearing.
Pressing Off the Input Shaft Bearing
